item.description:
Hope you can join us on Monday, April 6, from 7 to around 9 to talk about Giovanni's Room, by James Baldwin. We decided to stick with the same book because only a few of us had had a chance to read it at the first get together. Giovanni's Room is a quick (but intense) read, hopefully short enough to give folks time to get to it before the 6th, but feel free to stop by even if you haven't read it.

For those of you who couldn't make it make it on the 16th, we had a great first meeting - there were about 8 of us - a really nice group of folks, and there was general excitement and commitment about continuing to meet.

Feel free to bring a snack or beverage to share with the group, if you feel inspired!

My apologies for posting this a bit late, I wanted to be sure the community room was available (we've now reserved it.)

Also, I want to remind folks that this meetup.com group is temporary (because it's unfortunately kind of expensive) so we've started a google group home for us (which will be free) - please send an email to westernmassbookgroup@googlegroups.com to join the email list.

Look forward to seeing you soon : )
item.how_to_find_us: this time we're meeting in the community room, downstairs by the kids section
item.name: 2nd meetup! the book is still "Giovanni's Room" (only 150 pages)
